title: Belhus Woods Country Park Walking and Cycle Route

images.title: John Winfield / Whitehall Woods Lake
images.caption: Whitehall Woods Lake. Old gravel workings but now an attractive location for various wildfowl

images.title: Glyn Baker / A fallen tree in Belhus Wood
images.caption: A fallen tree and bluebells in Belhus Wood, South Ockendon, Thurrock. Modern forestry practice now allows fallen timber to rot as a home for invertebrates. A tidy wood is less wildlife friendly.

images.title: Belhus Woods Country Park car park by Robin Webster, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Car park

images.title: John Winfield / Late Autumn - Belhus Woods
images.caption: Late Autumn. The Country Park is jointly owned by Thurrock Council and Essex County Council and has a visitor centre. It is situated within the Thames Chase Community Forest and contains woodland and part of a parkland landscape designed by "Capability" Brown as a setting for Belhus House.

images.title: Glyn Baker / Thames Chase at  Belhus
images.caption: Thames Chase at Belhus. Newly planted mixed woodland in the park in 2005. Part of Thames Chase the new community forest to the East of London.

images.title: Robert Edwards / The Visitor Centre at Belhus Woods Country Park
images.caption: The Visitor Centre

images.title: Glyn Baker / White Post Wood
images.caption: White Post Wood. A bluebell lined path in the wood.

description: Enjoy the pretty lakes and peaceful woodland trails in this country park near Ockendon and Dagenham. There's also wildflower meadows, open space grassland, bluebells in the spring and lots of wildlife to see. The park is perfect for a nice waterside cycle or walk while there are also good facilities with a visitor centre selling refreshments and gifts. Just to the west you'll find Hornchurch Country Park where there's nice trails along the River Ingrebourne and the largest freshwater reed bed in London. The Ingrebourne Valley can also be picked up in the park.
